Posted By: Lifegainwithbite (3/23/2013 3:02:52 AM)
Rating:

@DarthKithkin:

You have a Fugitive Wizard enchanted with Freed from the Real and Quicksilver Dagger.
If an opponent gains control of your creature with Act of Treason, he can use the ability of the Dagger because it is "granted" to the creature ("Enchanted creature has..."). He can't use Freed from the Real because its ability is not depending on control of the enchanted creature. You still control both auras though.

posts.post_content:
[Pemmin's Aura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pemmin's Aura) is better on your own creatures, but Freed from the Real can lock down your opponent's creatures in a pinch. It really depends on your deck's strategy.  
  
Me, I use a playset of both for tapping madness.
